column1: Yoro is one of the 18 departments into which Honduras is divided. The department contains rich agricultural lands
column2: concentrated mainly on the valley of the Aguan River and the Sula Valley
column3: on opposite ends. The departmental capital is Yoro. The department covers a total surface area of 7
column7: 886 people. It is famous for the Lluvia de Peces (rain of fishes)
column8: a tradition by which fish fall from the sky during very heavy rains.

column3: is known for harvesting mahogany and cedar trees for exportation. The area also had a cattle industry.

column1: A number of football players are from the department.
